decision_conditions: The removal of the northern portion of the approved acoustic fence would prejudice neighbouring properties through a lack of consultation. Furthermore the works would potentially have an adverse impact on neighbouring amenities through unmitigated noise impacts. The development would also conflict with condition 3 of the original permission. In conclusion the changes cannot be considered non-material as they represent a form of development that differs materially from the planning approval, therefore cannot be considered to comply with Section 96A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. The application is therefore recommended for refusal.

description: Non-material amendment to planning permission ref. 49670/APP/2022/974, dated 10-06-2022 (Recladding of existing warehouse building, erection of single storey lean-to on south eastern elevation of building, erection of acoustic fence and associated works (involving demolition of existing lean-to)) to omit Northern portion of the acoustic fence.
